The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely revenge from an unseen creature from thousands of years ago.
For some people and possible audiences this can come off as really cheesy but I think it pulls you in so well into how the group was behaving to make some immensely emotional scenes create their love for one another

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over to other alleged 'La-La Land' superstars who are clearly suffering themselves. An irreverent nightmare of a cartoon with wild bursts of manic insanity . Sometimes creepy-like whimsy like "Mickey Mouse" springs to mind quickly

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back and reminds to a certain moment and place.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little coherence or actual martial arts, and ultimately that's true but there's one thing you have to remember with this movie; it's not meant to take itself seriously.
